definition: to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
surname Li
strict/severe

sentences.english: Still have to wipe my own arse though so needs more work.
sentences.chinese: 但是依然得自己擦屁股，所以需要再接再厉。

sentences.english: After the first victory, our army followed through to win every battle.
sentences.chinese: 我军初战胜利后再接再厉，打赢了以后的每一仗。

sentences.english: He followed up his success and started looking for new markets.
sentences.chinese: 他获得成功之后再接再厉，又开始寻找新市场了。

sentences.english: We, yinbao people will certainly work harder to achieved more as well.
sentences.chinese: 我们银宝人一定会再接再厉，做出更好的产品。

sentences.english: Smiles is a good test it, test had no choice but to continue the bad.
sentences.chinese: 考好的呢就是笑逐颜开，考坏的只好再接再厉了。

definition: variant of 再接再厲|再接再厉[zai4 jie1 zai4 li4]
to congratulate beforehand/to offer best wishes for
to guard against pride and impatience (idiom); to remain modest and keep cool
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
to live up to expectations (idiom)
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
in a spurt of energy
to strike while the iron is hot
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
(idiom) a good person, used to praise sb's moral integrity or courage
to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
to stand a good chance/to have great hopes/to be promising
to wish for/to desire/hope/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. to reorganize flags and drums (idiom); to regroup after a setback/to prepare for new initiatives/to attempt a comeback
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
